result.execSummary:
The defendant Latoya M. Burgin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Latoya M. Burgin is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Latoya M. Burgin was found guilty of Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees. 
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges. Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharge.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. Cooperate with JV Court orders. DOC shall promptly notify the court of any new or criminal charge made against the deft.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person pro se.  Agent Michael McConville present.  Purpose of hrg today is for unpaid financial obligations.  Remaining financial obligations are $415.15.  Deft reports she is working for temp agencies and attempting to pay her obligations and pay her bills.  Court previously signed an extension of probation for a period of one year.  No further court taken at this time.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty James Fields-Bowers.  Case is resolved.  Deft pleads guilty to count 5; found guilty by the Court.  Counts 4 & 6 are dismissed & read-in on State's motion.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for one year.  See conditions.  DNA ordered; notice given to deft.

Minutes:  15CM1039/15CM1040.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft, Robin Burgin, appeared late in person w/Atty Jeremy Chavez.  Deft, Latoya Burgin, appeared in person w/Atty James Fields-Bowers.  Brief arguments heard on Atty Fields-Bowers motion to dismiss counts 1, 2, & 3; motion is granted.  Based on this ruling, the State moves to dismiss counts 4, 5, & 6 in co-deft's case (St vs Robin Burgin).  Parties request FPT/JS dates.  FPT set for 2/1/16 @ 1:30pm, JS 2/22/16 @ 9am for both cases.

Minutes:  15CM1039/15CM1040.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  Special Pros K R Wells appeared for the State.  Deft, Robin Burgin, appeared in person w/Atty James Fields-Bowers.  Deft, Latoya Burgin, appeared 30 minutes late w/Atty Jeremy Chavez.  Atty Chavez not ready to proceed on his case; believes the court should address deft Robin Burgin's motion to dismiss.  Both cases set for FPT/Mtn to Dismiss on 12/7/15 @ 2:30pm due to ongoing jury trial.

Minutes:  15CM1039/15CM1040.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft, Robin Burgin, appeared in person w/Atty Jeremy Chavez. FPT adj 11/18/15 @ 2pm, JS 12/7/15 @ 9am.
